event_name: WHO declares Public Health Emergency of International Concern
description: WHO declared COVID-19 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern, marking the first official recognition of the global threat.
WHO officially classified COVID-19 as a global pandemic due to rapid worldwide spread.
Many countries introduced large-scale lockdowns, travel restrictions, and stay-at-home orders to contain the virus.
The first clinical trial for a COVID-19 vaccine (Moderna’s mRNA-1273) started in Seattle, USA.
The U.S. FDA issued Emergency Use Authorization for the Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine — the first approved vaccine.
The UK Medicines and Healthcare Regulatory Agency (MHRA) approved the Oxford–AstraZeneca vaccine for emergency use.
Mass vaccination programs started across most countries, marking the beginning of large-scale immunization efforts.
The Delta variant caused a significant surge in infections worldwide, with higher transmissibility and severe cases.
Scientists in South Africa identified the Omicron variant, leading to renewed global restrictions and record case numbers.

event_name: WHO declares end of global health emergency
description: WHO officially ended the COVID-19 global health emergency, signaling a shift to long-term management of the disease.
